## Preliminaries

### Install packages

Do this once, then comment it out.  Otherwise you will download the packages again every time you run the script.

I was prompted to restart R - I didn't.

```{r}
# install.packages("ggplot2")
# install.packages("ggpubr")
```

### Load packages

Run this every time.

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
```

## Plot the data in base R

Load the data and make a plot that matches Figure 2.8 on page 26 of the Higgs and Atwood chapter 2 reading


The plot() function is set up to make a blank plot.  text() then uses the same tilda notation as plot() to plot the labels.

```{r}
plot(isoelectric.pt  ~ freq, data = aa_dat,
     xlab = "label here",
     ylab = "label here",
     main = "title here",
     col = 0)
text(polar.req ~ freq, 
     labels = aa, 
     data = aa_dat, 
     col = 1:20)
```


## Plot the data in ggpubr

```{r}
ggpubr::ggscatter(x = "isoelectric.pt",
                  y = "freq",
                  data = aa_dat)
```
